alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kay, northwestern Noble, southeastern Grant and northeastern Garfield Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Lamont to 4 miles southeast of Enid. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enid, Ponca City, Blackwell, Tonkawa, Newkirk, Waukomis, Garber, Billings, Lamont, Breckenridge, Marland, Hunter, Fairmont, Kildare, northwestern Kaw Lake and Ceres. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 190 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
